meanings.definition: The quality or state of being impetuous.
meanings.sent1: Her impetuosities often led to hasty decisions.
meanings.sent2: His impetuosities sometimes caused him trouble.
meanings.sent3: The impetuosities of the puppy made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The impetuosities of the storm shook the entire town.
meanings.sent5: The impetuosities of the river were breathtaking to watch.

meanings.sent1: The impetuosities of his actions surprised everyone.
meanings.sent2: She regretted her impetuosities the next day.
meanings.sent3: His impetuosities in shopping always left him broke.
meanings.sent4: The impetuosities of youth can sometimes lead to mistakes.
meanings.sent5: The impetuosities of the driver caused a near accident.

meanings.definition: The force or violence of a physical action.
meanings.sent1: The impetuosities of the crashing waves were mesmerizing.
meanings.sent2: The impetuosities of the earthquake were felt far and wide.
meanings.sent3: The impetuosities of the hammer hitting the nail echoed in the room.
meanings.sent4: The impetuosities of the explosion shook the ground.
meanings.sent5: The impetuosities of the wind tore through the trees.
